metadata.Title: CVE-2018-25022 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Onion module in toxcore before 0.2.2 doesn't restrict which packets canbe onion-routed, which allows a remote attacker to discover a target user'sIP address (when knowing only their Tox Id) by positioning themselves closeto target's Tox Id in the DHT for the target to establish an onionconnection with the attacker, guessing the target's DHT public key andcreating a DHT node with public key close to it, and finally onion-routinga NAT Ping Request to the target, requesting it to ping the just createdDHT node.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtoxcore2 - 0.2.10-1build2
toxcore-utils - 0.2.10-1build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libtoxcore package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.10-1build2').
